formattedDescription.text: Learn how to fuel belonging without compromising who you are and what you need to perform at your best

authors.biography:
Lynn Seth, MPH, MA, is a performance and well-being expert with 20+ of coaching and facilitation experience.

Lynn has spent her entire career helping women and BIPOC populations normalize their needs so that they don't need to compromise who they are or how they feel. To do this, she uses a model that integrates the sciences of performance psychology and behavioral change with the needs of women and BIPOC populations. Lynn has worked as a corporate trainer and executive performance coach at the Johnson & Johnson Human Performance Institute for nearly 15 years. She also leverages her experience as the CEO of Lynn Seth Coaching & Facilitation, a successful development firm which specializes in helping women and BIPOC populations overcome obstacles, reach goals, and position themselves for success.
authors.headline: Performance and Well-Being Expert | International Speaker

description.text: Learn how to fuel belonging without compromising who you are and what you need to perform at your best

formattedDescription.text: Learn research-based strategies to foster resilience, not only to withstand adversity, but also to leverage it for transformation and innovation.

authors.biography:
Dr. Emily Anhalt is a clinical psychologist and cofounder and chief clinical officer at Coa.

Emily attained masters and doctorate degrees in clinical psychology in Berkeley, California. For the past fourteen years, she has been working clinically with executives, founders, and tech employees, and has conducted extensive research with prominent psychologists and entrepreneurs about how leaders can improve their emotional fitness. She has matched more than 800 people into therapy, and has collaborated with some of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world.
authors.headline: Clinical Psychologist, Cofounder and Chief Clinical Officer at Coa

description.text: Learn research-based strategies to foster resilience, not only to withstand adversity, but also to leverage it for transformation and innovation.

formattedDescription.text: Get expert advice for non-native English speakers on how to let others know that you understand.

authors.biography:
All Ears English helps global professionals achieve success abroad through curriculum-based online learning.

All Ears English helps professionals improve their English language skills for international business, travel, and higher education. Their award-winning podcast network achieves 5 million downloads per month. Instructors use a natural, non-traditional approach. The curriculum features real-life examples, roleplays, grammar explanations, and cultural insights. Occasional guests include authors, journalists, professors, and linguists from institutions including The Economist, Stanford University, the BBC, and more.

If you are looking for English language or communication training for your team, please visit https://www.allearsenglish.com.
authors.headline: Global Language Education Company for International Professionals

description.text: Get expert advice for non-native English speakers on how to let others know that you understand.

title.text: Are You Up to Speed? How to Signal Comprehension in an Email

formattedDescription.text: In this audiobook summary, hear five lessons about creating and cultivating healthy relationships, and how they can lead to a happier, more fulfilling life.

authors.biography:
Next Big Idea Club shares life-changing insights from some of the best new nonfiction books of the year.

Its latest feature, Book Bites, brings 15-minute audio summaries read by the authors themselves. With a constantly rotating list of titles curated by best-selling authors like Malcolm Gladwell, Susan Cain, Daniel Pink, and Adam Grant, members can choose to have books delivered to their door, via ebook, or as video ecourses streamed on the Next Big Idea app. Membership options vary, but all provide exclusive access to a content-rich reading community, with supplemental interviews, courses, discussion questions, and more. With over 8,000 members and counting, Next Big Idea Club is building connections through the experience of reading, one book at a time.
authors.headline: Life-Changing Insights from the Best New Nonfiction Books of the Year

formattedDescription.text: Discover the power and reliability of Rust, the statically typed, multiparadigm programming language, with tips and tricks to boost your productivity.

authors.biography:
Marcus Willock is a senior software engineer and content creator.

Marcus is trying to make the world a better place one line of code at a time. He has worked as a software developer for Jetty, Trip Advisor, SinglePlatform, and elsewhere. An expert in Rust and Python, and a noted speaker at conferences like Pygotham, his current role highlights his back-end network security skills as a senior software engineer at Virginia-based LookingGlass Cyber Solutions. Marcus has a bachelor of arts in mathematics from Arizona State University.

Find out more about his adventures with Rust by checking out his YouTube channel.
authors.headline: Senior Software Engineer and Content Creator

formattedDescription.text: Test your SQL skills with these concise challenges.

authors.biography:
Scott Simpson creates technology courses as a Senior Staff Author at LinkedIn.

Scott has been interested in computers since he was about seven years old, and for most of that time, he's been teaching friends, family, and strangers how to use them. This geeky hobby turned into a job with Apple during college. After completing his M.A. in education at San Diego State University, Scott helped to shape the Technology and Developer courses at lynda.com as a content producer. As a LinkedIn Learning Senior Staff Author, Scott focuses on teaching Linux, SQL, security, and other technology topics to a wide range of learners around the world. When he's not building technology courses, Scott enjoys travel, reading, and photography.
authors.headline: Creating Technology Courses as a Senior Staff Author at LinkedIn

authors.biography:
Big Think is one of the largest short-form video providers of soft skills knowledge.

Big Think is a thought-leadership platform that creates and curates the world's leading experts' insights and distills them into bite-sized knowledge for quick, easy, and actionable learning. Whether it is a neuroscientist, scholar, entrepreneur, or CEO, Big Think provides content from the best and brightest minds of today in ways to help you become better personally, or professionally.

The mission of Big Think is to help people get faster and smarter to help them achieve success in the 21st-century knowledge economy.

authors.biography:
Dr. Monica Clem is the vice president of the National Career Center at Teach for America.

A Certified Master of Career Services, Monica has over ten years of experience building teams and driving change in education, student services, and nonprofit management. Her work focuses on educational equity and first-generation student success to create opportunities, empower people and communities, and facilitate equitable social outcomes. The former executive director of career development and experiential learning at Edinboro University, Monica has a PhD in organizational learning and leadership from Gannon University in Erie, Pennsylvania.

authors.biography:
Emmanuel Henri is a full-stack developer with 20 years of experience in programming, technology, and design.

Emmanuel has been responsible for all aspects of client-driven web and mobile projects, including timelines and scope. These projects have used JIRA/Atlassian tools, agile methodologies, and languages and frameworks such as React, Angular, Node, Meteor, GraphQL, JavaScript, Swift, HTML, CSS (Sass), MongoDB, and MySQL. He also works in the 3D gaming world, using tools such as Unreal, ZBrush, Maya, and several others. He has a passion for creating applications and games that leverage the latest technologies in the aforementioned tools, frameworks, and languages.

For more information, go to mannyhenri.com.
authors.headline: Executive with 20+ years of experience in programming and design

formattedDescription.text: Focus on 10 rules that can help leaders at all levels, as well as people who aspire to lead.

authors.biography:
Dr. Todd Dewett is one of the world's most watched leadership personalities.

He is an authenticity expert, best-selling author, best-selling educator at LinkedIn Learning, a TEDx speaker, and an Inc. Magazine Top 100 leadership speaker. He is a thought leader and expert on leadership, focused primarily on authenticity and aspects of relationships and leader behaviors that drive success at work. His unique take on leadership has resulted in quotes in the New York Times, Businessweek, Forbes, TIME, and hundreds of other outlets. After beginning his career with Andersen Consulting and Ernst & Young he completed his PhD in management and organizational behavior at Texas A&M University and enjoyed a career as an award-winning professor and scholar. Todd has delivered over 1,000 speeches and created a body of educational work enjoyed by over 20,000,000 professionals around the globe. His recent clients include Microsoft, ExxonMobil, Pepsi, Boeing, General Electric, Caterpillar, and hundreds more. Visit his home online at www.drdewett.com.
authors.headline: Authenticity Expert, Educator, Author, Speaker

description.text: Focus on 10 rules that can help leaders at all levels, as well as people who aspire to lead.

title.text: Top 10 Rules for Highly Effective Leadership

authors.biography:
Harshit Tyagi is a data science instructor and mentor.

Harshit has helped over a thousand students master the fundamentals of programming and data science. In his roles at OpenClassrooms and Coding Ninjas, he leverages his technical expertise to conduct workshops and help students bring their course projects to the finish line. He also has a YouTube channel, where he covers fundamental concepts in data science and Python, interview tips, and more. In addition to focusing on data science education, Harshit has developed data processing algorithms with research scientists at Yale, MIT, and UCLA.

formattedDescription.text: In this course, adapted from the Negotiate Anything podcast, Susan Borke discusses how to prepare effectively for your next negotiation.

authors.biography:
Kwame Christian, Esq., MA is the CEO of the American Negotiation Institute.

In his work at the American Negotiation Institute, Kwame conducts corporate trainings that help professionals persuade, lead, and resolve conflict more effectively.

Kwame is the host of one of the world's most popular negotiation podcasts, Negotiate Anything. His best-selling book, Finding Confidence in Conflict: How to Negotiate Anything and Live Your Best Life, has helped countless individuals navigate difficult conversations.

In addition to his work at the American Negotiation Institute, he also serves as a business lawyer at the law firm of Carlile Patchen and Murphy LLP, a contributor at Forbes, and served as a professor of negotiation for The Ohio State University's Moritz College of Law.
authors.headline: CEO of the American Negotiation Institute

authors.biography:
The American Negotiation Institute focuses entirely on building negotiating skills for individuals and companies.

The American Negotiation Institute (ANI) embraces the statement that the best things in life are on the other side of difficult conversations. With a very diverse roster of training specialists, ANI offers workshops, coaching, online courses, books, negotiation guides and podcasts. They bring strategic and holistic vision to the complex skills and dynamics of successful negotiation and conflict resolution, and they aim to make negotiation skills more accessible, approachable, and understandable by helping people to realize that they negotiate every day.
authors.headline: Negotiation Consulting Firm Focused on Skill Building

description.text: In this course, adapted from the Negotiate Anything podcast, Susan Borke discusses how to prepare effectively for your next negotiation.

title.text: How to Prepare for Your Negotiations

His training specializes in finding new sales opportunities and maintaining customer relationships in an honest and trustworthy manner. He's coached sales teams from every corner of the globe and is a man on a mission to dispel the stereotype of the dishonest and untrustworthy salesperson.

headline.text: Trending for people in your industry

elements.title: Building an Application with Svelte and Firebase

descriptionV3.text: Svelte and Firebase both try to use the simplest set of tools possible in different ways. Svelte is a front-end, component-based framework that offers enhanced performance and a more approachable developer experience. Firebase is a backend-as-a-service platform that makes it easier to build and monitor great apps. In this course, learn how to combine the dependency-free client approach of Svelte with the core set of lightweight data storage tools in Firebase to create a quick foundation application. Instructor Ayodele Leom covers everything from basic setup to interactive design with Svelte.

errors.message: Unexpected error looking up data in BATCH_GET response.

descriptionV3.text: Svelte also allows you to create reusable components. This video explains the component logic.

errors.message: Unexpected error looking up data in BATCH_GET response.

authors.biography:
Shaun Wassell is a full-stack software developer who specializes in programming and industrial automation.

Shaun started programming in middle school with the hope of making awesome video games. He went on to get a degree in computer science and pursue a professional career developing software. He enjoys both full-stack and mobile development. Besides computers, Shaun also has an interest in music, architecture, gardening, and craft beer.

Victor Mejia is a senior UI engineer and instructor.

He specializes in building great user experiences and teaching others the art of software development. He currently works at McGraw-Hill Education, where he is building web applications using cutting edge technologies (Angular, TypeScript, Redux, and webpack). He advocates and teaches modern JavaScript development practices with test-driven and performance-driven approaches. Victor is also the organizer of the Angular Orange County Meetup, and he's a happy husband and dad of two beautiful children.

formattedDescription.text: Develop your understanding of China's security and privacy regulations to be successful in an ever-evolving global marketplace.

authors.biography: Mandy Huth is the vice president of cybersecurity at Kohler, Co.</br></br>Whether she's designing a strategy, building a relationship, or influencing a major initiative, Mandy is prepared to tackle whatever professional challenges may lie ahead. A Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP®), Mandy boasts technical expertise and the ability to reliably achieve results. Prior to her role at Kohler Co.—a $7 billion manufacturer of kitchen and bath, power, and decorative products, in addition to hospitality—she was the director of information security at Smarsh, a software company focused on comprehensive archiving solutions for highly-regulated industries and business enterprises. Additionally, she was the director of information security at Belden, a $2 billion company, where she built out the security organization for the company and senior manager of IT security, infrastructure, and operations at Tripwire, where she directed the information technology functions of the company. Her skills include cloud computing, security, and IT service management.
authors.headline: VP of Cybersecurity at Kohler, Co.

Carlos is a senior solutions architect at Infiniti Consulting where he helps California community colleges move their traditional data centers to the cloud.

Over the course of his career he has worked for several large telecommunication providers managing and configuring network devices using numerous tools and languages, including Java, Groovy, Python, Perl, and PHP.

__data.text: The Good Life: Lessons from the Longest Study on Happiness (Book Bite)

__data.biography:
Next Big Idea Club shares life-changing insights from some of the best new nonfiction books of the year.

Its latest feature, Book Bites, brings 15-minute audio summaries read by the authors themselves. With a constantly rotating list of titles curated by best-selling authors like Malcolm Gladwell, Susan Cain, Daniel Pink, and Adam Grant, members can choose to have books delivered to their door, via ebook, or as video ecourses streamed on the Next Big Idea app. Membership options vary, but all provide exclusive access to a content-rich reading community, with supplemental interviews, courses, discussion questions, and more. With over 8,000 members and counting, Next Big Idea Club is building connections through the experience of reading, one book at a time.
__data.headline: Life-Changing Insights from the Best New Nonfiction Books of the Year

__data.text: In this audiobook summary, hear five lessons about creating and cultivating healthy relationships, and how they can lead to a happier, more fulfilling life.

formattedDescription.text: Discover the power and reliability of Rust, the statically typed, multiparadigm programming language, with tips and tricks to boost your productivity.

authors.biography:
Marcus Willock is a senior software engineer and content creator.

Marcus is trying to make the world a better place one line of code at a time. He has worked as a software developer for Jetty, Trip Advisor, SinglePlatform, and elsewhere. An expert in Rust and Python, and a noted speaker at conferences like Pygotham, his current role highlights his back-end network security skills as a senior software engineer at Virginia-based LookingGlass Cyber Solutions. Marcus has a bachelor of arts in mathematics from Arizona State University.

Find out more about his adventures with Rust by checking out his YouTube channel.
authors.headline: Senior Software Engineer and Content Creator

formattedDescription.text: Test your SQL skills with these concise challenges.

authors.biography:
Scott Simpson creates technology courses as a Senior Staff Author at LinkedIn.

Scott has been interested in computers since he was about seven years old, and for most of that time, he's been teaching friends, family, and strangers how to use them. This geeky hobby turned into a job with Apple during college. After completing his M.A. in education at San Diego State University, Scott helped to shape the Technology and Developer courses at lynda.com as a content producer. As a LinkedIn Learning Senior Staff Author, Scott focuses on teaching Linux, SQL, security, and other technology topics to a wide range of learners around the world. When he's not building technology courses, Scott enjoys travel, reading, and photography.

formattedDescription.text: Learn how to create a culture of psychological safety in which team members feel valued, seen, and comfortable taking risks.

authors.biography:
Big Think is one of the largest short-form video providers of soft skills knowledge.

Big Think is a thought-leadership platform that creates and curates the world's leading experts' insights and distills them into bite-sized knowledge for quick, easy, and actionable learning. Whether it is a neuroscientist, scholar, entrepreneur, or CEO, Big Think provides content from the best and brightest minds of today in ways to help you become better personally, or professionally.

The mission of Big Think is to help people get faster and smarter to help them achieve success in the 21st-century knowledge economy.

formattedDescription.text: In this course, adapted from the Negotiate Anything podcast, Susan Borke discusses how to prepare effectively for your next negotiation.

authors.biography:
Kwame Christian, Esq., MA is the CEO of the American Negotiation Institute.

In his work at the American Negotiation Institute, Kwame conducts corporate trainings that help professionals persuade, lead, and resolve conflict more effectively.

Kwame is the host of one of the world's most popular negotiation podcasts, Negotiate Anything. His best-selling book, Finding Confidence in Conflict: How to Negotiate Anything and Live Your Best Life, has helped countless individuals navigate difficult conversations.

In addition to his work at the American Negotiation Institute, he also serves as a business lawyer at the law firm of Carlile Patchen and Murphy LLP, a contributor at Forbes, and served as a professor of negotiation for The Ohio State University's Moritz College of Law.
authors.headline: CEO of the American Negotiation Institute

authors.biography:
The American Negotiation Institute focuses entirely on building negotiating skills for individuals and companies.

The American Negotiation Institute (ANI) embraces the statement that the best things in life are on the other side of difficult conversations. With a very diverse roster of training specialists, ANI offers workshops, coaching, online courses, books, negotiation guides and podcasts. They bring strategic and holistic vision to the complex skills and dynamics of successful negotiation and conflict resolution, and they aim to make negotiation skills more accessible, approachable, and understandable by helping people to realize that they negotiate every day.
authors.headline: Negotiation Consulting Firm Focused on Skill Building

authors.biography:
Harshit Tyagi is a data science instructor and mentor.

Harshit has helped over a thousand students master the fundamentals of programming and data science. In his roles at OpenClassrooms and Coding Ninjas, he leverages his technical expertise to conduct workshops and help students bring their course projects to the finish line. He also has a YouTube channel, where he covers fundamental concepts in data science and Python, interview tips, and more. In addition to focusing on data science education, Harshit has developed data processing algorithms with research scientists at Yale, MIT, and UCLA.

formattedDescription.text: Learn how to use Apollo, a flexible, production-ready GraphQL client for React and React Native apps.

authors.biography:
Emmanuel Henri is a full-stack developer with 20 years of experience in programming, technology, and design.

Emmanuel has been responsible for all aspects of client-driven web and mobile projects, including timelines and scope. These projects have used JIRA/Atlassian tools, agile methodologies, and languages and frameworks such as React, Angular, Node, Meteor, GraphQL, JavaScript, Swift, HTML, CSS (Sass), MongoDB, and MySQL. He also works in the 3D gaming world, using tools such as Unreal, ZBrush, Maya, and several others. He has a passion for creating applications and games that leverage the latest technologies in the aforementioned tools, frameworks, and languages.

For more information, go to mannyhenri.com.

formattedDescription.text: Discover new value, purpose, and meaning in your life by pursuing a career path in teaching and education.

authors.biography:
Dr. Monica Clem is the vice president of the National Career Center at Teach for America.

A Certified Master of Career Services, Monica has over ten years of experience building teams and driving change in education, student services, and nonprofit management. Her work focuses on educational equity and first-generation student success to create opportunities, empower people and communities, and facilitate equitable social outcomes. The former executive director of career development and experiential learning at Edinboro University, Monica has a PhD in organizational learning and leadership from Gannon University in Erie, Pennsylvania.

formattedDescription.text: Focus on 10 rules that can help leaders at all levels, as well as people who aspire to lead.

authors.biography:
Dr. Todd Dewett is one of the world's most watched leadership personalities.

He is an authenticity expert, best-selling author, best-selling educator at LinkedIn Learning, a TEDx speaker, and an Inc. Magazine Top 100 leadership speaker. He is a thought leader and expert on leadership, focused primarily on authenticity and aspects of relationships and leader behaviors that drive success at work. His unique take on leadership has resulted in quotes in the New York Times, Businessweek, Forbes, TIME, and hundreds of other outlets. After beginning his career with Andersen Consulting and Ernst & Young he completed his PhD in management and organizational behavior at Texas A&M University and enjoyed a career as an award-winning professor and scholar. Todd has delivered over 1,000 speeches and created a body of educational work enjoyed by over 20,000,000 professionals around the globe. His recent clients include Microsoft, ExxonMobil, Pepsi, Boeing, General Electric, Caterpillar, and hundreds more. Visit his home online at www.drdewett.com.
authors.headline: Authenticity Expert, Educator, Author, Speaker

shortBiographyV3.text: Technical Support Specialist and Software Engineer

__data.text: Technical Support Specialist and Software Engineer

__data.title: Building an Application with Svelte and Firebase

descriptionV3.text: Svelte and Firebase both try to use the simplest set of tools possible in different ways. Svelte is a front-end, component-based framework that offers enhanced performance and a more approachable developer experience. Firebase is a backend-as-a-service platform that makes it easier to build and monitor great apps. In this course, learn how to combine the dependency-free client approach of Svelte with the core set of lightweight data storage tools in Firebase to create a quick foundation application. Instructor Ayodele Leom covers everything from basic setup to interactive design with Svelte.

__data.text: Svelte and Firebase both try to use the simplest set of tools possible in different ways. Svelte is a front-end, component-based framework that offers enhanced performance and a more approachable developer experience. Firebase is a backend-as-a-service platform that makes it easier to build and monitor great apps. In this course, learn how to combine the dependency-free client approach of Svelte with the core set of lightweight data storage tools in Firebase to create a quick foundation application. Instructor Ayodele Leom covers everything from basic setup to interactive design with Svelte.

__data.title: Lightweight and flexible tools for building applications
What you should know before watching this course

descriptionV3.text: Svelte also allows you to create reusable components. This video explains the component logic.

__data.text: Svelte also allows you to create reusable components. This video explains the component logic.

__data.title: An introduction to Svelte and Firebase

lines.caption: - [Instructor] In Svelte, an application
is composed of one or more component.
A component is (indistinct), self-contained block of code
that is written into a dot Svelte file
and contains JavaScripts, HTML,
and CSS that belong together.
Component can be a big or small,
but they're usually clearly defined.
The most effective components have a single obvious purpose.
For a project, you might have app dot Svelte,
header dot Svelte, footer dot Svelte, and many more.
Which, when taken together, comprise an entire application
and your form is in a three-leg structure.
App dot Svelte is the root component injected
directly into the dome by the index dot JS file,
which is the main dot JS file as well.
The benefit of defining components can be compared
to the more general best practice
of organizing your code into manageable pieces.
In addition to encouraging (indistinct)
making your code simpler to maintain
extent and reason about. It will also assist you
in understanding how to develop
how they relate to one another.
The Component Format.
Components are the building blocks of Svelte application.
A component may have up to three optional sections,
which is the script that contains JavaScripts
that runs the component, the style which contains the scope
CSS styling for the component, and markup,
this is where the HTML goes into.
How do you know what to split out into a new component?
This is a good question.
There are no add rules for this.
Some individuals prefer an intuitive strategy
and begin by looking at the markup and drawing boxes
around each component and sub-component
that appears to have its own logic.
Other people apply the same techniques and for deciding
if you should create a new function or a new object.
One of the strategies is the single responsibility
principle, which states that a component should ideally
only perform one task.
If a given component expand, it is at that point
that you can decide to divide the component
into more focused, manageable parts.
Both strategies ought to support one another
and aid in your decision making regarding how
to arrange your components more effectively.
Let us set up a Svelte login form
to explain the components.
Go to your desktop
and create a folder called form.
I've created my own form.
Then clone the Svelte template
into the folder using (indistinct).
So how do I do this?
I open my cmd, that's my command prompt,
and then I CD into my desktop
and CD into my form.
Then you use degit Svelte
JS forward slash template.
You click enter and it will
clone the Svelte template into this folder.
The next is to run npm install.
Npm install to install all the dependencies
of the application.
You cannot clear all that you have in your app dot ds,
so I have opened it here,
your app dot ds, you can clear all what you have there
and a copy of this will be made available for you.
You can see I have split my application into two components.
I have app dot Svelte and login dot Svelte.
If you look at login dot Svelte,
I have the first one, which is the scripts,
I have the style,
and I have the HTML.
So the script contains the function
that is the JavaScripts function
that handles the form of the page.
While the style contains the CSS
that styles the entire page,
while the HTML aspect is the form part of the page.
And for my app dot Svelte,
I have to import login.
That is the component that you created,
import login from login dot Svelte,
and then I import two modules from Svelte on mount.
Every component that is being created
will always be mounted in the lifecycle process.
This is the first date,
and I make a set context that is
for the component to be able
to communicate with one another,
I use the set context method.
So these are the functions that will perform the operation
and I have connected it together.
Also, you can see how I bring it in
the component of the login.
This is the login form you can see
and this is the submit.
I imported login on line two,
which I'm using here on line 30.
And the submit is another component that I'm also using
from this part to make sure
that everything is working perfect.
So let's open our terminal and do npm run build
to check if our component is working.
Npm run dev.
Let's open our browser.
Perfect. Working correctly.
You can now say you know about component
and you've been able to understand
how to break your application into a functional component
to make up an entire application.

formattedDescription.text: Learn how to use the JavaScript you mastered for front-end Angular development to build powerful applications with Firebase, a suite of tools from Google.

authors.biography:
Victor Mejia is a senior UI engineer and instructor.

He specializes in building great user experiences and teaching others the art of software development. He currently works at McGraw-Hill Education, where he is building web applications using cutting edge technologies (Angular, TypeScript, Redux, and webpack). He advocates and teaches modern JavaScript development practices with test-driven and performance-driven approaches. Victor is also the organizer of the Angular Orange County Meetup, and he's a happy husband and dad of two beautiful children.
authors.headline: Senior UI Engineer and Instructor

authors.biography:
Shaun Wassell is a full-stack software developer who specializes in programming and industrial automation.

Shaun started programming in middle school with the hope of making awesome video games. He went on to get a degree in computer science and pursue a professional career developing software. He enjoys both full-stack and mobile development. Besides computers, Shaun also has an interest in music, architecture, gardening, and craft beer.

formattedDescription.text: Develop your understanding of China's security and privacy regulations to be successful in an ever-evolving global marketplace.

authors.biography: Mandy Huth is the vice president of cybersecurity at Kohler, Co.</br></br>Whether she's designing a strategy, building a relationship, or influencing a major initiative, Mandy is prepared to tackle whatever professional challenges may lie ahead. A Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP®), Mandy boasts technical expertise and the ability to reliably achieve results. Prior to her role at Kohler Co.—a $7 billion manufacturer of kitchen and bath, power, and decorative products, in addition to hospitality—she was the director of information security at Smarsh, a software company focused on comprehensive archiving solutions for highly-regulated industries and business enterprises. Additionally, she was the director of information security at Belden, a $2 billion company, where she built out the security organization for the company and senior manager of IT security, infrastructure, and operations at Tripwire, where she directed the information technology functions of the company. Her skills include cloud computing, security, and IT service management.
authors.headline: VP of Cybersecurity at Kohler, Co.

description.text: Develop your understanding of China's security and privacy regulations to be successful in an ever-evolving global marketplace.

title.text: China's Cybersecurity and Privacy Regulations: Essential Training

__data.text: China's Cybersecurity and Privacy Regulations: Essential Training
Develop your understanding of China's security and privacy regulations to be successful in an ever-evolving global marketplace.

__data.biography: Mandy Huth is the vice president of cybersecurity at Kohler, Co.</br></br>Whether she's designing a strategy, building a relationship, or influencing a major initiative, Mandy is prepared to tackle whatever professional challenges may lie ahead. A Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP®), Mandy boasts technical expertise and the ability to reliably achieve results. Prior to her role at Kohler Co.—a $7 billion manufacturer of kitchen and bath, power, and decorative products, in addition to hospitality—she was the director of information security at Smarsh, a software company focused on comprehensive archiving solutions for highly-regulated industries and business enterprises. Additionally, she was the director of information security at Belden, a $2 billion company, where she built out the security organization for the company and senior manager of IT security, infrastructure, and operations at Tripwire, where she directed the information technology functions of the company. Her skills include cloud computing, security, and IT service management.
__data.headline: VP of Cybersecurity at Kohler, Co.

__data.text: Develop your understanding of China's security and privacy regulations to be successful in an ever-evolving global marketplace.

formattedDescription.text: Explore the ins and outs of the WordPress deployment process with Amazon Web Services cloud development kit (AWS CDK) v2.

authors.biography:
Carlos Rivas is an AWS infrastructure expert.

Carlos is a senior solutions architect at Infiniti Consulting where he helps California community colleges move their traditional data centers to the cloud.

Over the course of his career he has worked for several large telecommunication providers managing and configuring network devices using numerous tools and languages, including Java, Groovy, Python, Perl, and PHP.
